body:
is it possible to use this api to broadcast a text message to multiple phone numbers ? if yes, please show an example for its usage.

thanks in advance.

comment_data.body:
Two methods:
1) make some php code that sequentially sends all messages to a number
2) add all numbers to a group and send one message to that group (note the group limit).

at least, as long as broadcasting has not been added to the source....

Nope.

I've dug up the code to send broadcast messages from the WhatsApp.dll I pulled from my WP7 device recently. This is what I could make out after a quick glimpse.

This is what a broadcast  text message looks like (broadcast also supports media):
```xml
<message to="broadcast" type="chat" id="broadcast-1453546">
    <broadcast>
        <to jid="3234234234@s.whatsapp.net"></to>
        <to jid="6576546567@s.whatsapp.net"></to>
        etc. (limit seems to be 25 recipients)
    </broadcast>
    <x xmlns="jabber:x:event">
        <server></server>
    </x>
    <body>derp</body>
</message>
```
I'm 90% sure that this is accurate, but I have some more important stuff to fix right now (a man's gotta eat ya know)

I'll implement it when I get to it.
Soon.

Or you can do it if you want.
Oh god I will burn for this, all those spammers... D:

@shirioko great work.

Any chance you can dump the rest of the DLL when you get a moment (...after dinner ;) )

I've shared the link to the DLL files before:
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/68235039/WhatsAppDLL.zip
You can use Reflector or ILSpy to view the content.

How good is your C#? ;)
Hahah. Ok, I've bitten off more than I can chew.

Here's the FunXMPP class which pretty much contains all the protocol nodes and communication with whatsapp
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/68235039/funxmpp.cs.txt

Have "Fun" ;)
@shirioko can you implement it today (when you get back home as usual :) ) ?
I was going to say no, but okay..
awesome ... then post your commit link here (after you do it)  if possible .. a million thanks to you ...

Syncing...


It's up!
cool ... i will give it a try ...

three broadcast messages and a regular message:
![broadcast](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1610953/503976/ef302a9e-bcda-11e2-8046-c44566df0010.jpg)

Am I missing something here.

From the Docs on Whatsapp: http://www.whatsapp.com/faq/android/23130793

Looks like the RECIPIENT must have the SENDERS phone number in their contacts otherwise the RECIPIENT will not get the broadcast message.

This is good news. It means this is not very useful for spammers....

Or did I miss something?
WhatsApp doesn't have a contact lit of any kind. I assume it's managed by the app (whether or not to send a receipt based on the local contacts list)

Yes, but that still shows that your code won't do as much damage as I first thought. If a spammer tries to send me a broadcast message, because I won't have his number in my local contacts - I shouldn't technically see the message.
Hmm I hadn't thought about it like that. Interesting.

hello @shirioko  again
can i have a try for this method??
I've already synced it so go ahead.

where can i find it?
I didn't understand what you meant by synced it ? to where ?

Gee I don't know? To my phone? To GitHub?
https://github.com/shirioko/WhatsAPI
how are you registering a new number?

Ooooookay this is turning into an FAQ. Not gonna happen.

I don't spam people so I've been using the same number for almost half a year now without getting blocked.
And if I needed to register a number, there are PLENTY of issues explaining how to do it right now.
Something about a phone and an SMS code.
can you explain these plenty issues ?

No.

If you actually read the issues you wouldn't even have to ask.
https://github.com/venomous0x/WhatsAPI/issues/337
https://github.com/venomous0x/WhatsAPI/commit/09eb2a84b7bae6c3f650841875180771535bbfbd

Hi shirioko,

I have requirement to send message on whatsapp to multiple recipients may be in thousands. 

Please ans. my following questions?
1. Can i send text message to multiple recipients? or i have to broadcast that message to multiple recipients as you have written above code snippet of SendBroadcastMessage?

2. If i have to broadcast a message then is there is any limit in broadcasting message to multiple recipients like 25 0r 30? because we have recipients list in thousands.

3. I have tried your above code of SendBroadcastMessage but didn't find classes/DLLs at following links:
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/68235039/WhatsAppDLL.zip
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/68235039/funxmpp.cs.txt

4. Can you provide me latest code and helper DLLs to broadcast message?

Thanks & Regards
Charanjot Singh

Message broadcasts are limited to ~30 numbers, I haven't looked up the limit in a while now.
You can download the latest DLL in my WART project or compile it from source yourself, it doesn't use any external or NuGet libraries.

title: broadcast a text message to multiple phone numbers
